sentences.english: I am quiet, she is humming, When the Stars Go Blue.
sentences.chinese: 我沉默不語，她時而嘆息，此刻繁星也變得愁悶。

sentences.english: She would have been sad, if sadness had been possible to her.
sentences.chinese: 如果她有可能愁悶的話，她會發愁的。

sentences.english: Change your laughter to mourning and your joy to gloom.
sentences.chinese: 將喜笑變作悲哀，歡樂變作愁悶。

sentences.english: And in the morning when Joseph came to them he saw that they were looking sad.
sentences.chinese: 到了早晨，約瑟進到他們那裏，見他們有愁悶的樣子。

sentences.english: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
sentences.chinese: 到了早晨，約瑟進到他們那裏，見他們有愁悶的樣子。

sentences.english: Zhang Liao returned to Hefei, his heart heavy over the loss of Wan.
sentences.chinese: 張遼爲失了皖城，回到合淝，心中愁悶。

sentences.english: When Joseph came to them the next morning, he saw that they were dejected.
sentences.chinese: 到了早晨，約瑟進到他們那裏，見他們有愁悶的樣子。

sentences.english: His illness caused me to feel gloomy.

definition: lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
cups and dishes in complete disorder (idiom); after a riotous drinking party
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
